clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of an Analgosedation Protocol in Mechanically Ventilated Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of an Analgosedation Protocol in Mechanically Ventilated Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate how the investigators provide sedation (medicine that make you sleepy) in the investigators intensive care unit (ICU). This study will look at a new way of using sedation in the ICU to see what effect it has on patients and if it decreases the amount of time spent on mechanical ventilation (machine that breathes for you), and in the ICU.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be assessed daily for the duration of their stay in the ICU, an expected average of 4-5 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the entire length of their ICU stay, expected average of 4-7 days
Participants will be followed for 28 days from enrollment into the study

clinical_study.condition: Effect of Protocolized Sedation on Days of Mechanical Ventilation in the ICU

arm_group.description: Sedation protocol is a document that will be used to guide the adjustment of sedation in the ICU.

intervention.other_name: The sedation protocol is a document that wil lbe used by healthcare providers to guide sedation used in the ICU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients 18 years of age and older
- Patients expected to require mechanical ventilation for greater than 48 hrs
Exclusion Criteria:
- Need for continuous neuromuscular blockade
- Severe chronic neurocognitive dysfunction
- Tracheostomy at the time of study enrollment
- Alcohol withdrawal risk or symptoms
- Drug overdose
- Chronic use of narcotics
- Active seizures
